website_summaries.verdict: The EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM is the best zoom you can get for shooting video with the EOS Rebel T4i, but it's not quite as sharp as its non-STM sibling.
cons: Not quite as sharp as non-STM version of lens

customer_reviews.title: Great Jill-of-all lenses
customer_reviews.text: I have been working with an 18-55mm (standard), 10-18mm (wide angle), and a 50mm (portrait lens) for the last few months, but this new 18-135mm has taken the win for my favorite. It is a bit heavier than your average lens, however, I no longer have to lug around my 3 lenses because this 18-135mm sort of gets all the jobs done. From a beginner's perspective, this a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for beginners and pros alike!
customer_reviews.text: I have only the kit lens and then this guy because I particularly enjoy taking my shots zoomed in. I plan to get a 75-300mm down the road but for now this camera has taken some stunning pictures! I recommend this as a versatile "walkaround" lens for anyone who is new to photography or is not shooting anything specialized. A friend who is more "pro" than I am recommended this to me, and this is even one of his go-to lenses. It is a wonderful replacement to the kit lens!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen DiGiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect "Do Everything" Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect "do everything" lens. Wide enough to get the big group shots, long enough to get distant subjects or tight close-ups. On my 7D, autofocus is very quick. I photographed a helicopter flying overhead, and the autofocus nailed 9/10 shots. Sharpness is also very good. This competes very well with the EF-S 15-85 (actually matches overall according to DxOMark), and also the EF-S 17-55 (only one point less according to DxOMark). The plus is that you get much more range! Of course, inside with low light is not this lens' friend, but for most situations, this is going to stay on your camera more often.
customer_reviews.author: danfazTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase, however, I have a couple complaints. Firstly, the focus ring isn't sensitive enough. In order to focus from the most deep to the most shallow depth of field, you have to turn it forever, making quick focus adjustments a bit of a hard task. Also, this is a 67mm lens, which is different from the standard lens that probably came with your Canon.I was aware of this, and it's not a bad thing, just keep in mind that the filters and lens attachments won't necessarily fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Great moderately priced, all-purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: A real workhorse at a great price. I just finished a week shooting a conference with generally horrible lighting situations, and this lens almost never left my camera. It easily handled everything from exhibit floor wide images to speaker close-ups and candids. Crisp images, nice bokeh (I was honestly--and pleasantly--surprised when I started looking at the first images in Lightroom), not too heavy, and the focus was quick and quiet. A fantastic upgrade to a kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: SP Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Great video lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the holy grail of video lenses when paired with a camera with full time auto-focus in video such as the t4i. You will never hear this lens focusing in videos, unlike USM or standard focus lenses. This is a good all around lens to use for the casual photographer that also shoots video. There are better portrait lenses out there, but if you could only take one lens and had to shoot both stills and video, this would be the lens to take, provided that your camera is APS-C format. Full frame cameras will not support this or any other EF-S lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Upgrade From Stock Lenses
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens choice. Offers a wide range from 18mm to 135mm. No more swapping between stock lenses to get a telephoto shot. The only downfall I found so far is that the final image is slightly cropped vs what you see in the viewfinder. Takes excellent pictures. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking to upgrade from stock lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! This was advertised as an STM lens and I received a USM lens. Huge difference. Not even sure if I received a new product as advertised. What a drag especially since I was hoping to use it for my daughters soccer game this weekend. Fix your product description and or send the right product.
customer_reviews.author: DiDi Names

customer_reviews.title: Great All-Around Lens
customer_reviews.text: There are so many options for lenses, but I don't regret getting this one. My wife uses this lens and her T7i for work of mostly taking pictures close-up of people's eyes. It focused great! It needs a lot of distance for it to focus, so it's definitely not a macro lens, but the ability to zoom in makes up for it! It's a great all-around lens, especially for a starter.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: It completes me
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old Canon EF 28-105 3.5-5.6. I have a Canon 70d and wanted something for a walkaround that had image stabilization. This fits the bill. plus gets wider and reaches out further. It's seems sharper, faster focus, and quieter. I bought it as used, but it was as new. I'm guessing it came as a kit lens for someone. I added a lens hood and have a UV filter on the way. Anyway, it rounds out my lens package for photos and videos as I now have a Canon 10-18 mm, 18-135mm and 55-250mm, and the EF 50mm 1.8, all with the STM motors.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is superb. I used it to shoot a wedding and it performed extremely well. Although I bought it used, it was in very good condition. It is versatile, providing the ability to get close to subjects and to shoot them at a great distance. The lens has a good weight to it as medium to larger lenses tend to have. It packs well and is easily installed on a camera body with its twist and lock design. Overall, I'd recommend this lens for the casual photo enthusiast and professional.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great. I bought it because it allows me to not have to keep switching between my regular and telephoto lens. The only thing about it, which is not the fault of the lens but my own, is the STM I believe doesn’t work with my camera body (T3) so it doesn’t help much with the autofocus when recording video, but I bought it knowing this added feature may not be available to me due to having an older camera body.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: EF-S 18-135 mm Lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens because it is flexible, has a wide range of focal length and adapts well. I purchased mine prior to a trip to Israel in which I shot more than 1200 pics all with this one lens. I did it with the Auto Setting / No Flash in 98 percent of the cases and they came out perfect with few exceptions - none of them due to the lens. This is probably the highest priority lens to buy for an EOS series camera.
customer_reviews.author: Albert L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good lens though I bought it refurbished and have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good lens though I bought it refurbished and have to return it as I had lens creep. I do not know if this is normal for a lens like this or a product of the refurbishment, my Canon 55-250 lens does not do this. The lens is also heavy, easily the heaviest lens I own, which probably helps exacerbate the lens creep. Still it is a good walking around lens.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens with good reach
customer_reviews.text: This is the kit lens that should've be packaged with my T2i when I purchased it! I really like this lens! It has more reach than the kit EFS 18-55 (which hasn't even been on my camera in several years). It's lightweight and the STM focuses really fast...and quietly too.
customer_reviews.author: Real Killer

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. You have to be very specific of where you want it to autofocus. It does close go portraits to far away pics. Its the perfect In between lens. I wish I had bought it earlier. I leave this lens on for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ginah

customer_reviews.title: Very versatle lens
customer_reviews.text: The Canon camera package that I purchased came with a 18-55mm lens and a 75-300mm lens. I kept finding myself always changing the lens while I was shooting photos. The 55mm lens didn't get close enough and the 75mm lens was getting too close. The 18-135mm lens works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: rjd

customer_reviews.title: Too many flaws
customer_reviews.text: The fine-tuning ring on manual focus does not work on the one I received. Also this lens takes in an uncontrolled amount of artificial light especially at night and creates "light bubbles," particularly on the Canon t5. Perhaps the t7 will perform better with it, but I'm doubtful. This lens has become another cheap, mass-produced product. Best to pay more (about $400) for the RF24-105.
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: A major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The day that I received this lens I photographed a electrical tower from my patio and compared the image to that of my Canon SX710HS "Pocket Camera" with a 30X optical zoom. While the SX710's photo covered the entire photo, the 18-135mm lens' image only covered a minor portion of its photo. If you want a good telephoto lens and do not need a DSLR, you may wish to try a SX710 for under $200 first before deciding to purchase this lens for $268 and paying an additional $599 for a Canon EOS like the one that I used to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Better than new (part 2)
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Another GREAT deal from District Camera!!! The item came a day before the estimated date, was packaged very nicely, and was in better condition than described. The price of the lens was way below new prices. The lens is brand new?!!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: I have three of them and have always been delighted with the results and the flexibility of the lens
customer_reviews.text: I think this the most versatile lens in the Canon lineup for general picture taking. I have three of them and have always been delighted with the results and the flexibility of the lens. It give sharp and crisp images and works well for any situation that I have encountered.
customer_reviews.author: DennisO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens
customer_reviews.text: Needed a better lens than what came with my Canon T5i. This lens will be my carry around lens used for most of my photography, great versatility and takes very clear focused photos.
customer_reviews.author: Cushman Ken

customer_reviews.title: Error message, unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: The lens only works 50% of the time!!!! After taking one or two photos, I get an error message! It’s totally unreliable for photo shoots!! I would have returned it, but I didn’t even use it for the first time until 6 weeks after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Rengifo

customer_reviews.title: Received as expected.  Best all-around lens.  "Don't leave home without it."
customer_reviews.text: Received as expected. Best all-around lens. "Don't leave home without it." This thing is great for those up-close or wide angle shots, as well as great zoom to catch things you can see well with your eye and want to capture close-up. I also love the no-noise STM focus.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile and my go-to lens
customer_reviews.text: This single lens stays on my camera and only comes off when I need a 400+mm shot. Great quality pictures with little distortion with abundant range for framing exactly the shot you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like!
customer_reviews.text: Like this lens, lets you cover a lot of distances without changing lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Haines

customer_reviews.title: must have had a bad bump from previous owner
customer_reviews.text: Lens was used as described, must have had a bad bump from previous owner, filter ring was bent but manage to get one on the lens. Image is sharp auto focus works great. If I couldn't have fixed the filter issue I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image quality
customer_reviews.text: This lens provides excellent image quality/sharpness and is comparable to more expensive Canon lenses. Excellent focal length range, light weight, quick focusing. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens as recommended from a an online review. It's a bit heavier than I thought but not a problem. I'm new and learning, so understanding all of the nuances of this lens will come with time. So far, I like it and the sharp, clear pics.
customer_reviews.author: Bofficer

customer_reviews.title: Great travel lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably becoming my favorite lens. It is perfect for touring and traveling and even outdoor hikes. The range is just right. No need to haul around a wide-angle and telephoto lens for the most part. A little more weighty than some of my smaller lenses but not as heavy as my telephoto. Beautiful picture quality with this lens. It isn’t noisy at all. The focusing is pretty seamless. It fits most every need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I like this focal range on a crop camera. When I first got the original Rebel I bought a Sigma 18-125, that was my go to lens because of the range. When I got the M and then the 60D I wanted something longer that the 18-55 STM kit lens, but wanted the STM for videos. This fits all the requirements. I know that it is slow and a variable aperture, but it is a great walk around lens in good light.
customer_reviews.author: GTogs

customer_reviews.title: Great walk-around lens
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile lens, replaces a 24-85 EF lens that I passed along to my sister. I haven't run any sophisticated tests on it, but in using it for landscapes, family functions, county fair, and other general applications I have no complaints with the resulting images - nice colors and sharp images. I've paired it with a 7D body as my general walk-around combination. Lives fully up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality lens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice lens. Hardly any chromatic aberration like the Tamron 18-300 I tried and sent back. Distortion is at a minimum. Images are sharp and rich in color. My wife loves it as a walk around lens!
customer_reviews.author: frodoboyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a basically brand new lens
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to finally step into the DSLR world, and wanted a decent zoom lens to start with since multiple lenses did not fit into my budget. Doing a little online research, I decided that the 18-135mm with image stabilization and stepper motor focus would be best since I intend to use my camera for video occasionally, and the ultrasonic focus can be noisy in the built-in mic when shooting video. Buying a refurbished lens really dropped the price, and got me a lens that is in as good as new condition. The lens functions perfectly, and had no blemishes out of the packaging. Great alternative to paying full retail price, especially if you have a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E.

customer_reviews.title: it's a smart purchase
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good all-around Lens. It's a much better lens than the 18-55 Lens that came with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome general use.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens, exactly as described by seller and a very good walk-about or general use lens. The range is fantastic and the IS is a god send for freehand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I absolutely love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer and am still considered a newbie, but I absolutely love this lens. I know I haven't even began to touch on its capabilities. It is sturdy and very quiet, I can't even hear it when it auto focuses. I love it and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: musiclover505

customer_reviews.title: Everything was better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to say that the order I received was better than expected in several ways. Perfect condition. Received faster than expected. Was a newer model than the one I replaced, which I did not know there was a quieter version. All this to say, thanks! A job well done.
customer_reviews.author: tribalschaible

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality and value of this lens
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this lens on a recent trip. I love the quality of the photos I took with it. I bought this as a walk around lens to replace one that I had used for many years. It was a great upgrade and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: ML. Woehl

customer_reviews.title: Great lens and price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for the money. I use it often and have been very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great "Go to First" lens
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this lens really what I was looking for, something to replace the 18-55mm lens that comes with all Ti series, it gives you the close "everyday" use and can range out to 135mm. Works well with all settings, photo and also video. Perfect for what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: RanMorita

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes focus is off, but probably could be improved by changing focus setting on the camera body. In general the pictures are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: John Dowling

customer_reviews.title: Great lense for beginners and pros too
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent lense.. takes sharp photographs but the only downside is that in order to focus from the most deep to the most shallow depth of field, you have to turn it forever, it can be a little annoying.. but other than that is a great lense!
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower 🌻

customer_reviews.title: Great for both snapshot and video clip
customer_reviews.text: Very silent. I can't hear any noise from lens when it adjust the focusing. Great for both snapshot and video clip. However, the Lens is not really bright.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: manual focus didn't work
customer_reviews.text: product had minor wear damage. not in original package. manual focus didn't work so all pictures had to be taken in auto focus, which I don't like personally. product was returned within 24h of purchase
customer_reviews.author: claudialeon95

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended to get this as a alternative daily use/all purpose ...
customer_reviews.text: Night and day difference in comparison to the 18-55 that came with my camera. Was recommended to get this as a alternative daily use/all purpose lens. SO GLAD I DID. Other than real far off/close up shots of my kids on the field at some sporting event or something, I am hard pressed to think that I will ever take this one off my camera again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice focus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an outdoor shoot that I am doing in a few days. Do far I skip very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: certainly not disappointed in my images
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a vacation to Europe... decided I would only carry this lens... certainly not disappointed in my images...and video
customer_reviews.author: S McD

customer_reviews.title: Great all around lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is one of the best deals in the Canon line up. For the average photographer it covers 99% of scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Robin J. Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: The most versatile lens
customer_reviews.text: This is the most versatile lens I own! Image quality is fine!
customer_reviews.author: JuanferVe

customer_reviews.title: good lens, good delivery
customer_reviews.text: arrived quickly (a few days before promised), lens was as described, great for a larger range of far/close photography without being too clunky/big
customer_reviews.author: Snarkus

customer_reviews.title: Silent & Quickfast Autofocus
customer_reviews.text: This lens focuses with impressive speed and it does so nearly silently. It is great for taking photographs and it really shows off when recording video on a Canon T4i. The focusing is neither audible nor distracting & slow during videos recorded with this lens. The range of focal lengths makes this a very useful walk around lens for taking photos, as well.
customer_reviews.author: MD Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: A lens to love and live with.
customer_reviews.text: Great multi-use lens. Unless you have to have a single focal lens this is an excellent lens. It is sharp and quite easy to use. With the added feature of internal stabilizing it is an excellent single lens for walking around and grab shots. I use this at parks and various nature and inside locations.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens and Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and versatile lens with IS technology. The seller delivered just as promised. I couldn’t be happier with their service and the lens. At delivery, they provide you with direct contact information should anything need addressed.
customer_reviews.author: William Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for autofocus video - vignettes way too much at 18.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to use with the autofocus on my C100. I love the range, and the silent autofocus. I like how you do not lose light when zooming - unlike my 24-105 L lens. I HATE how much vignetting there is at 18. I have to digitally crop all of my footage if I shoot at 18.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great seller!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this lens! It’s perfect for every day use. I wanted it to take casual family pictures that are good quality and it does not disappoint. Exactly what I was looking for. The seller also provides great customer service, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!
customer_reviews.text: This telephoto zoom lens is great for all purposes. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Manny Correira

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and QUIET
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, bought it to take to a flower show. I wanted to get a little closer than the kit lens of 18-55. What I didn't expect was the quiet, it take excellent images either wide or telephoto or any where in between. The only thing that could be heard was the shutter on the Canon T3i camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzsky

customer_reviews.title: Happy buyer
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Came in fast and looks brand new! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All you may need
customer_reviews.text: My new all purpose lens for my Canon T3 DSLR. Can be used as a macro lens or zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: It helps me take great shots with amazing clarity
customer_reviews.text: This lens is worth every penny. It helps me take great shots with amazing clarity... I mean what else can I say.... The price, shipping and packaging were also excellent !!!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: A fine, versatile lens.  Look for a white box.
customer_reviews.text: If you get the white box version, this lens is a bargain. It is optically quite nice from end to end and it can make your Canon DSLR into a high quality super zoom. It is especially slick combined with the tiny SL1 (or a successor).
customer_reviews.author: Wackezoid

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around lens for newer EOS cameras
customer_reviews.text: Great all-around lens for my 70D. Silent and quick. I really like it. Zoom range is perfect. Optics are pretty good. For video it's great too. Near silent operation..
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quick focus lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for light lens with range of 18 to135
customer_reviews.author: roger wong

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my 18-200mm and it’s perfect. Clear image
customer_reviews.author: Ocampo's

customer_reviews.title: Another great lens from Canon
customer_reviews.text: Faster auto focus compared to 55-250. Very quiet. If you don't like changing lens between 18-55 and 55-250, 18-135 is the best all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Canon 80D video and photos look really great! Does exactly what i need it to do!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: My second one. My first on did not survive a bad rainstorm on the boat.Great lens for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great lens worth its money.
customer_reviews.text: The lens worked spectacularly. Everything came properly wrapped and protected. For the price, it was certainly a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens for my T3i. Very pleased with the f/s range and the wide zoom range. Would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Landscape Pictures
customer_reviews.text: The landscape pictures with this lens come out great if I use the diaphragm from 5.6 to 11. The IS feature works amazing too!
customer_reviews.author: elif pilicer

customer_reviews.title: nice lens resonable price.
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty sharp and fast, seems solidly built. I have only had it a few weeks so i can't speak to long term durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good lense
customer_reviews.text: It's a great lense. Little heavy. The cover is easy to lose. I had gora mail saying if I gave a review no matter what I can get a cover and tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, product is as described. I am still checking it out but so far so good. I’ll recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shankamome

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Sharp, quick AF, smooth zoom. Very pleased. Good all purpose lens.
customer_reviews.author: Shimoda

customer_reviews.title: Overall great experience!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite camera lens! It came very quickly and it was packaged safely with bubble wrap. You can’t go wrong with this product. Oh and the picture quality is amazing! 😍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the product it came in on time and has very good quality i am looking foward to using this lens more on my trips.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kelly

customer_reviews.title: MUST-HAVE lens if you use the Canon T4i
customer_reviews.text: If you have the Rebel T4i and got it with the kit lens, you will soon finding yourself dumping the kit lens for an STM lens. The T4i has AF during the video mode, but this feature is only useful if the lens is silent, like this STM lens. The T4i does great film quality even in low light situations, so it;s great to finally have a camera that really does both without having to compromise too much. This lens has a great range and is perfect for the one-lens-only type like myself that just want to travel light and just want to carry a moderate size holster bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. O. V. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great all around lens
customer_reviews.text: My go-to lens if I am doing general photography and can only take one with me
customer_reviews.author: John Selter

customer_reviews.title: This is a great all-around lens for the Canon EF-S camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all-around lens for the Canon EF-S camera. Going to need to add a mic for my run and gun...
customer_reviews.author: Brad Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my camera!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a more universal lens for my canon 7D. I had a ultra wide angle and a 50mm, but I needed a more standard zoom, I did a lot of research, and I ended up with this one, I absolutely love it and don't regret anything!
customer_reviews.author: Shorty78666

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens! It seems like a good, everyday use lens.
customer_reviews.author: C.A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very dope nothing bad to say Trust the videos you watch on this lens
customer_reviews.author: Kavon prestige Abrams (fb)

customer_reviews.title: Good versital lens.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens,but wish it was a little lighter. Takes sharp pictures. If you are looking for a mostly stay on the camera lens, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an all around lens....since I've purchased this I haven't put on any if my other lenses
customer_reviews.author: james r. karkruff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens! It is now my "go to lens" for most of my photography with my Canon T3i.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best versatile lense I've used. I keep using this lense as my main lense. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. A good everyday lens.
customer_reviews.author: Looks amazing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens- focus is fast, quiet and sharp and the focal range is great as an all-around lens. I would definitely recommend it. I would add, however, that it was sent in an unmarked white box so appears to have been a kit lens. It did have a fully U.S. warranty. Delivery by seller was quite fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cabin Guy

customer_reviews.title: worth it..
customer_reviews.text: fantastic.. works great.. nice carry around.. no more switching lenses... price not bad fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: mom4444

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE LENS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE. The absolute MUST HAVE for anyone shooting video.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bess Champion

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens at a good price.  Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Looking for this lens and found this one as a "used" lens. It works perfectly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Sciacca

customer_reviews.title: a nice lens
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice lens. The STM system works well on my 70D. It was as advertised by the vendor and arrived a few days ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a must lens for the t4i, t5i, t6i ot t6s.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: a really great lens
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and still own other Canon lenses. But this lens beats them all except some similar lenses costing two or three times the cost of this one. The lens focuses quickly and properly. It is very quite, not quite silent, but very close. The IS properties of the lens are outstanding (as the are in other Canon lenses I own). Cost is nominal compared to the excellent properties of this lens. PS. Do not be afraid to order white box items through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetgold

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is good for anyone that is starting out photography!
customer_reviews.author: Long

customer_reviews.title: this lens is absolute amazing. things that jump out right away
customer_reviews.text: wow... this lens is absolute amazing. things that jump out right away: SILENT auto-focus that is so much better than the previous USM auto-motors, and the SPEED of the auto-focus is insanely fast. I've own a Tamron, 3 Canon lens, and a Tokina lens before purchasing this to my photo kit, and am amazed at the absolute build quality and overall workman ship of it. It will be my walk-around lens and paired perfected with my 12-25mm Tokina wide-angle lens. For the average/above average APC SLR photographer, that's really all you need!! 5 STARs
customer_reviews.author: Optimized_Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens!
customer_reviews.text: The lens performs vary well. It is great for video and stills.
customer_reviews.author: iGio

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: Cant believe the difference in quality and operation of this lens over standard kit lenses. So quiet on focus thought it wasnt working. Fast and snappy. Excellent definition on pictures on all focal lengths. IS works wonderfully from daytime to nighttime shots.
customer_reviews.author: redwingsfansfc

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: Use this as my all around lens on my 77d
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM Lens(White box, New)
product_meta.description:
The EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM is ideal for video and still images alike, featuring refined Image Stabilization system that delivers up to four equivalent stops of shake correction throughout the zoom range; and offers a maximum magnification of 0.28x at the telephoto end.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




CANNON EF-S 18-135MM F/3.5-5.6 IS STM










Designed to exceed expectations and ideal for video and still images alike, the new EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM marks a new standard for EF-S lenses. It features a refined Image Stabilization system that delivers up to four equivalent stops of shake correction throughout the zoom range; and offers a maximum magnification of 0.28x at the telephoto end, while remaining even more compact in size. This EF-S lens supports the Canon EOS Rebel T4i DSLR's Movie Servo AF feature for smooth and quiet continuous AF during movie shooting by utilizing a new six-group zoom system and the adoption of a stepping motor and focus mechanism. High-speed autofocus is achieved thanks to an Inner focusing system, high-speed CPU, and optimized AF algorithm. Appearing for the first time in a Canon lens is Dynamic IS (Movie Shooting Mode only) that uses a wide image stabilization correction range to help ensure steady video while shooting when walking.


Whether shooting movies or stills, image quality is phenomenal, with one UD and one PMo aspheric lens providing high resolution and high contrast images with reduced chromatic aberration throughout the zoom range. A 7 blade, circular aperture ensures beautiful, soft backgrounds and optimized lens coatings ensure excellent color with minimized ghosting and flare. A zoom ring lock even prevents the lens from accidently extending.
